WorkItem.Description:
I am using source code build: 45485.
The proc for this is 678 armor pen.  Refreshing from wow armory, and in game tooltip all confirm.
I am at 48.44% armor pen (678 rating, without ArP gems).  Softcap being 722 for this item.
I run an optimize with this item selected (without ArP gems selected), optimize finishes, changes the proc to 540.57 armor pen, reducing its value.
Â 
It is as if it averages out the proc, adds it to my ArP rating, then uses that new value to see if i am over softcap, then claims I am wasting ArP rating.
WorkItem.Summary: [Hunter] Needle-Encrusted Scorpion (may affect others than hunters too)

Comments.Message: It determines whether you are breaking your cap first.

if i am only at 678, why would it lower the armor pen from the proc, since even with the proc I would only be hitting 1356?

Also, it seems if I leave it at the reduced armor pen value, and optimize again, with no changes at all, it changes the armor pen on the proc again, this time down to 500.57 (and now puts darkmoon card greatness as better).

Logically, I would think it would (with ArP gems selected), suggest 2 20 ArP gems, putting me at 718, then still with the full proc of 678 have me at 1396.

I have figured out the problem.  In one of my slots I have a piece of gear checked that has armor pen, but my better piece has none.  In the optimize it considers that piece of gear, which puts me over softcap, and lowers the trinket.  However, when it determines this, and switches back to my main piece, the trinket armor pen change remains.  I assume this is because the modification of the actual item in the item cache, instead of a temporary item w/ adjusted armor pen.  So the problem really is that you cant optimize multiple pieces of gear correctly with the trinket if any combination will bring you over softcap because of the way it modifies the trinket in its testing/analysis.

It doesn't actually edit the item at all, we just take less value from the proc.

Can you post your char file (before and after)?
The data inside ItemCache.xml is changing to the adjusted value.  I will upload my before/after in a minute, just gotta save/run optimize.

Just a note, my gemming template is only 20 agil, 10agil/10 crit/nightmare tear.

If I include 20 ArP into the mix, it gems me ArP over agility, which puts me way over the softcap, then drops the trinket proc to like 378, which of course is a waste.

Looking at your Optimize screen, I notived that you set 2 Talent requirements, which suggests you have been optimizing with Talents, which is a REALLY REALLY bad idea. Only a couple of models actually support this properly.

Looking at the rest of it now.

In raiding enviroment, sometimes I need to bring trueshot, and sometimes not, so I am forcing the trueshot talent (if i dont force it, readiness is not even selected although its in the shot rotation), and I force 2 pts in rapid killing just because I like having the back to back rapid fire :)  it does seem to support it fine, however, what talent doesnt optimize fine is "Aspect Mastery".  If it is not selected in the current talents, it does not realize its a dps increase over some of the other talents in marksmanship.

Example:

10885 right now w/ aspect mastery (9395 me/1490 pet)
10790 w/o aspect mastery (9399 me/1391 pet)

while optimizing for overall rating

To put it bluntly DON'T optimize with talents, I REALLY don't trust the results and neither should you. There are too many talents that don't have value so it will just throw them randomly to reach some other talent that actually does have value.

After reviewing the files, running some optimizes and replicating the issue, I did see that you are correct there was a bug that was permanently altering the item. I have made some changes to the code that will prevent that from ever happening again and some new optimizes now place you within earshot of the ArP softcap and Needle equipped to it's full effect.

The next version will no longer have this issue, until then the only option for you to have a working file is to compile the latest SVN.

Downloaded, compiled, must say, working beautiful now, thanks! :)  Since this applies to other ArP trinkets as well, I am sure it will be a welcome fix to probably all classes that use any procing ArP trinkets.
